summary: This is the non-prosecution agreement between Jeffrey Epstein and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida, deferring federal prosecution in favor of state charges. It outlines Epstein's agreement to plead guilty to state charges, serve a specific sentence, and provide compensation to identified victims, in exchange for the federal government not prosecuting him or his potential co-conspirators.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the investigation and agreement. He agrees to plead guilty to state charges and comply with terms to resolve federal criminal liability.

persons.name: R. Alexander Acosta
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of Florida
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney who authorized the non-prosecution agreement, deferring federal prosecution.

persons.name: Gerald Lefcourt
persons.context: Attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein, who signed the agreement.

persons.name: Lilly Ann Sanchez
persons.context: Attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein, who signed the agreement.

connections.description: Lefcourt is listed as counsel to Jeffrey Epstein and signed the non-prosecution agreement.
Sanchez is listed as an attorney for Jeffrey Epstein and signed the non-prosecution agreement.
Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, authorized the non-prosecution agreement with Epstein, establishing a prosecutorial relationship.

events.title: Deadline for Guilty Plea and Sentencing
events.description: Epstein is required to use his best efforts to enter his guilty plea and be sentenced by this date.

events.title: Self-Reporting Deadline for Sentence
events.description: The United States has no objection to Epstein self-reporting to begin serving his sentence by this date.

events.title: Federal Investigation Period
events.description: The period investigated by the U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI for offenses Epstein may have committed against the United States.

keyFacts: The agreement defers federal prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein for serious charges including conspiracy to traffic minors for prostitution, in exchange for him pleading guilty to state charges of solicitation of prostitution and solicitation of minors.
Epstein agreed to a binding recommendation for a 30-month sentence: 18 months in county jail followed by 12 months of community control.
The U.S. Attorney agreed not to prosecute any potential co-conspirators of Epstein, provided he fulfilled the agreement's terms.
The federal grand jury investigation was to be suspended, and all pending subpoenas held in abeyance, contingent on Epstein's compliance.
Epstein agreed to provide compensation to victims identified by the U.S. Attorney and waive certain legal defenses in related civil suits under 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255.
